title: Artificial Intelligence - MODERATE Level
description: üìà Level up your knowledge! This quiz delves into $\mathbf{search \, algorithms}$ üó∫Ô∏è, **Machine Learning** paradigms üìä, and the architecture of $\text{Artificial \, Neural \, Networks \, (ANNs)}$ üï∏Ô∏è. (20 Questions - 40 Minutes)

questions.text: Which **search algorithm** uses a $\mathbf{heuristic}$ function to guide its path from the current node to the goal?
In $\mathbf{Machine \, Learning}$, what is the process of adjusting the weights of a neural network based on the error rate called?
Which type of learning involves training a system to make a sequence of decisions to maximize a cumulative reward?
The $\mathbf{Adversarial \, Search \, Algorithm}$ commonly used in games like chess is...
In $\mathbf{Unsupervised \, Learning}$, the primary goal is to find...

options.a: A relationship between input and output labels
options.c: Hidden patterns or structures in unlabeled data
options.d: The probability of a single event

questions.text: Which machine learning model can suffer from **vanishing or exploding gradients** during training?
The concept of **Completeness** in a search algorithm means that it is guaranteed to...

options.c: Find a solution if one exists

questions.text: What is the output of the $\mathbf{Sigmoid \, Activation \, Function}$ typically mapped to?
The $\mathbf{Decision \, Tree}$ algorithm primarily uses which metric to determine the best feature for splitting data?
What is the major drawback of $\mathbf{Minimax}$ without $\text{Alpha-Beta \, Pruning}$?

options.b: It is not guaranteed to find the best move
options.c: It explores too many irrelevant branches, leading to high time complexity

questions.text: In $\mathbf{Natural \, Language \, Processing \, (NLP)}$, what is $\mathbf{Tokenization}$?

options.b: Breaking text into smaller units (words, phrases, symbols)
options.c: Determining the sentiment of the text

questions.text: The $\mathbf{Bias-Variance \, Tradeoff}$ in Machine Learning relates to balancing...
The $\mathbf{Perceptron}$ is a fundamental unit of a neural network that is primarily used for...
Which $\mathbf{probabilistic \, model}$ assumes that the presence of a particular feature in a class is independent of the presence of any other feature?
The **Discount Factor** ($\gamma$) in Reinforcement Learning controls the importance of...

options.c: The size of the state space

questions.text: The primary disadvantage of $\mathbf{Greedy \, Best-First \, Search}$ compared to A* search is that Greedy Search is not...

options.b: Optimal (guaranteed to find the shortest path)

questions.text: What is the goal of $\mathbf{Dimensionality \, Reduction}$ techniques like Principal Component Analysis (PCA)?

options.b: Reduce the number of features while preserving essential information
options.c: Improve the visual design of the data

questions.text: In a $\mathbf{Multi-Layer \, Perceptron \, (MLP)}$, the layers between the input and output are called...
The $\mathbf{Decision \, Boundary}$ in a classification problem is the surface that separates...
Which metric evaluates the percentage of positive instances correctly identified by a model?
